website_summaries.verdict: An affordable and portable alternative to traditional Scrabble, with rules that level the field between novice and experienced players. Fast and competitive.
pros: Zippered banana pouch is very portable, self-contained
Improves spelling skills for younger players
cons: Game is more solitary than traditional Scrabble

customer_reviews.title: For those of you complaining about the quality, go ...
customer_reviews.text: For those of you complaining about the quality, go to the Bananagrams website, click the button that says "purchase through Amazon here," and buy it that way. It started out a dollar more expensive but there was a 20% off coupon on the Amazon purchase so I ended up saving $. The 2 sets I purchased this way are the original type tiles, solid and well made. Type face is consistent and clear. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: ethoffman

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Banangrams is a great game and I love it, but the one on Amazon's site is a COUNTERFEIT! This is NOT the REAL game. It has very cheap tiles that look like someone's kid drew in the letters. The tiles are very light and do not feel like the real ones. The bag is clearly inferior with a hole in the seam. I returned this immediately and bought the real game from Target. Also available at Barnes and Noble. It is really a fun game, but you want the real one and not the fake one that is sold on Amazon. BEWARE and DO NOT BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kaszimir N. Togas-Arayn

customer_reviews.title: poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: So bummed. Love this game so bought one and just played for the first time. Apparently too late to return although defective. Two of the pieces have marks big enough to identify them so that someone might choose them purposed while playing. I mean - all you have to do as the manufacturing company for quality control is make sure there is a letter on one side and nothing on the other side. They make so much on each game they could at least quality control better. Wouldn’t buy this from amazon because can’t return past thirty days but in a store it would be fine. (Didn’t play til today).
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: NOT the official Bananagrams!!!
customer_reviews.text: This item/seller(ExSavings) is NOT for the official Bananagrams with the high quality ceramic/clay tiles. These are cheap plastic knock-offs stuffed into an official bag. All literature shipped with the game indicates the original tiles, so I'd put this firmly on the distributor. The official Banangrams is still made with the ceramic/clay tiles that you may have seen before and is under a different item name/number.
customer_reviews.author: Slapy

customer_reviews.title: So much fun for seniors!
customer_reviews.text: We use the Bananagrams weekly for our Seniors who live in our retirement home. All levels of activity and mentality enjoy this game. Some make words in a single line, and that is good too.. We work on spelling, and the meaning of words! Every Senior facility should use this game. I happily recommend it. We all look forward to playing it each week.
customer_reviews.author: Carol L. Levy

customer_reviews.title: The game is kind of dumb, but the tiles create endless fun!
customer_reviews.text: We found that the rules of the game almost make no sense and are not very inclusive. The game is played individually against others rather than requiring any sort of cooperation or central focus around a board. Instead of following the rules we have just started dumping them on the table when we visit with family/friends and make a rule (no less than 5 letter words) or pick a theme (oceans, holidays, things, people, places) and have the common goal of using every single tile. It is a fun way to not compete, have conversation, and keep busy!
customer_reviews.author: Rick and Ashly

customer_reviews.title: Great quick group game!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for people that like writing, scrabble, competition, puzzles, etc. It's a bit like scrabble in you make a board spelling out words that connect off each other, but its different in that each person has their own personal board, and there are no points to the letters. It is a time-based game of who can use all their tiles the fastest. I wouldn't recommend this game be played in a group that is not evenly matched- it is very obvious if a player is falling behind more quick spellers, and could result in bad feelings. It only works well if everyone is evenly matched.
customer_reviews.author: Kathrine Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Compact, durable, easy to read tiles, fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: Cute bundle of easy to read tiles, suitable for tossing in a bag to go places, and for all ages. We play by the rules that are inside the banana, but we add a theme to each round, such as "food" or "ocean life". Have bought this as a gift a few times now. Even my friends living on sailboats have enjoyed it's compact, yet durable and sturdy qualities, not to mention that all kinds of people can enjoy playing this. Learning to spell words is fun for young kids or those learning English.
customer_reviews.author: Kare

customer_reviews.title: Better alternative to Scrabble
customer_reviews.text: If you enjoy word games, you will love Bananagrams. This is similar to Scrabble - you use letter tiles to form a word grid - but the game itself moves along faster, is easy to learn and is much more portable than a full board game. Banangrams also lends itself to a wide range of ages and more players can be accommodated. For larger groups, a version with double the number of tiles is also available. I especially love the pace of this game compared to Scrabble. I don't know anyone who doesn't love Bananagrams...
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Anyone who loves scrabble will like this game too!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who are scrabble lovers like me and my family will definitely appreciate this game. Received it very fast in the mail and played it the same day. It is easy to learn and fun to play. My 12 year old loves it too and it’s good to keep her spelling and mind active in a positive way. My husband says it gives him anxiety by us moving around our letters but I think he is just excited and so eager to win the game. We all love it and will definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful in small groups or alone
customer_reviews.text: Fast-paced and fun word-building game. Always a go-to hit for a few players or as a solitaire (solo) game. If players don't know Spanish, leave those few add-on letters out, or use them and allow English or Spanish words. High quality product, well contained in a small reusable package, and simple to use. We are even using this for teaching our 3 year-old granddaughter how to recognize letters and how they fit together to spell words. Many wonderful uses.
customer_reviews.author: JimK

customer_reviews.title: received the game in CHINESE letters!
customer_reviews.text: I rarely use Amazon, and this is why. I bought the Banangrams game and when I unzipped it to take the tiles out, they were all CHINESE characters instead of English letters! I just shook my head and I now have to go through the hassle of returning it. Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: cicero

customer_reviews.title: Fast Paced Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This game is much like Scrabble, but different in all of the right ways. Instead of being turn-based, all players are rushing to get through their tiles at once. The tiles are placed freely and not on a board. Players can change and edit their tile placement throughout the match which brings much more strategy and energy to the game. It can be quite stressful trying to place tiles and not get too far behind, but it is great fun!
customer_reviews.author: ChefKronk

customer_reviews.title: Great after-dinner family game!
customer_reviews.text: Love this game! The tiles are well made and who doesn’t like a good banana pouch? We tweaked the rules to make the game more chill and challenging. We added scoring based on the length of the words to encourage players to work on longer words, which slows down the game and makes it less intense and more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie P

customer_reviews.title: Such a fun game to have around
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are SUPER into board games, so we have an entire shelving unit for them. This, however, is easily one of the most used, simply because it's so portable. We brought it with when we were waiting for someone to have surgery, and we played it for a couple hours! It's very easy to learn, and it's just fun. Plus, it's pretty entertaining to see what words you come up with!
customer_reviews.author: DianeTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: A FAVE GAME!  We Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My family absolutely adores this game! We love that you can play this with all ages. From my parents in their 80's to my youngest daughter and her friends at 10 - it's so much fun. We took it on Spring break with our friends and played for hours. It makes you use your head and some strategy and is better than sitting in front of your phones. When we have a large group of people we play with 2 packs of the Bananagrams. I would HIGHLY recommend to anyone! A fave for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Sue S

customer_reviews.title: Fast paced, light hearted game
customer_reviews.text: By far our favorite game. There's not a lot of board games and strategy games that we enjoy with just us (two people). But this one is perfect for us because Neither of us are significantly better than the other person. So the outcome is wildy different than any other game we play. Usually after a while one of us improves in a game to a point when we can't lose. But Bananagrams offers a fun, quick paced game that we both enjoy and both want to kill eachother over. Not only that, but it's easy enough to teach friends and guests and light hearted enough to play and not have to commit a whole evening.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste Clark

customer_reviews.title: Very good game.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. My granddaughters (7 and 11) - not so much. We don't compete - just make up our words and try to insert them. You can use whatever tiles are left to make up your words. They like that and I assume they are learning new words and spelling them. We tried using the 11 year old spelling words hoping that would give her another way to look at them. That didn't go well and I had to look for where she hid the banana. In the past we had an apple - same idea. Don't have that at this house. I recommend the game - just make up your own rules.
customer_reviews.author: Adirondack Nana

customer_reviews.title: Great game! I'm a high school English teacher and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great game! I'm a high school English teacher and I play this game with my coworker to keep us sharp. I also invite students to play when finished with tasks early. It's fun and allows then to brush up on their spelling and vocabulary. I often break students up into pairs and have them work as a team to complete an 11 tile challenge or a 21 tile challenge. the boys I babysit are much younger (9 and 11) and they love this game too. I highly recommend it for teachers, babysitters, and anyone who wants to have family fun!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: One of our favorites
customer_reviews.text: This game is great for a quick play (10-20 minutes depending on your skill) that is different every time. Form your own "Scrabble" board in a race against your opponent. Every new word must connect with a previous word, so you must choose whether to go for the simple words for time or figure out longer words to give you more options later. My wife and I enjoy playing together after a meal. If you like word games, this is definitely for you!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE REAL THING! Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is off-brand crap. Sure, it works. But I expected an Amazon’s choice product to be the real thing. These pieces are hollow, right out of a mold, with letters sloppily stamped on. Go to the store and get the real thing. The quality is so offputting.
customer_reviews.author: A Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Play with Caution! Highly Addictive
customer_reviews.text: If you like quick (~10min) games and do not have the patience for games that take all night, this game is for you! Although you can play with just two people, the ideal number of players is 4-6. True, you can play this game with your Scrabble pieces but it's more fun with these tiles. In addition to being way more travel friendly, they're thicker and easier to turn than Scrabble tiles plus there's no "wildcard" blank tiles which makes the game more challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Dean O

customer_reviews.title: Excellent game that doesn't get old!
customer_reviews.text: Cute banana container squashes nicely in a purse or suitcase. The tiles do NOT fade, discolor or wear out ... and we've played Bananagrams for years! Elementary children can play. So can very competitive adults who are determined to WIN this time!!! Its just as fun with 2 people as it is with 4 or 5. This is not one of those games that will end up in the closet, forgotten. Its too much fun!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy B

customer_reviews.title: So fun?
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can play this on my own, just with my husband, or with a group of friends! We get bored of scrabble easily because of how slow paced it can be, so we enjoy that you play at your own pace with this game. The bag it comes in it perfect to travel with, and takes up very little space which I love!
customer_reviews.author: Patty Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Fun & Educational
customer_reviews.text: My kids and I love this game! I bought this for a recent vacation as I thought it seemed like a fun, portable game. We all learned the rules quickly and played game after game after game while on vacation. I love the cute little banana carrying case, and love that it helps my 6- and 8-year old get creative with forming words and practice their spelling. Very fun!
customer_reviews.author: Queen City Mama

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely addicting game!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely addicting game! For anyone who enjoys playing Words with Friends, Scrabble, or any other word related game, you definitely need to try this out. The rules are really simple and you can play games over and over again. Depending on the skill level of other players in your group, games can last between 10-20 minutes. So quick turnarounds make for really enjoyable experiences. I’ve heard about this game for a number of years but never really played it or knew or anyone who had it. I finally had the chance to play it via a friend’s set, and it was such an enjoyable experience that I had to buy my own set. It’s that good!
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Scrabble upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my mom who loves scrabble, but none of us ever want to play because waiting for your turn is boring. This game eliminates that problem and the rounds are shorter overall. Also there is some strategy involved. It’s really fun for 2-6 players, any more than that and it’s better to get the bigger set with double the tiles.
customer_reviews.author: Meggie

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This game is a great combination of speed and strategy. I'm a big fan of Scrabble, but I hate how slow it can be when people take forever to think about their turn. Bananagrams has the perfect solution by having players race against each other. This is definitely in my top 3 favorite word games!
customer_reviews.author: S. Wachter

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I played this with an adult friend, her 11 year old daughter, and my just about 9 year old granddaughter. Easy to learn the very few game "rules" . My granddaughter needed significant assistance the first 2 rounds and a little assistance in the following ones. However, she did not feel intimidated by it. Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's bananas!
customer_reviews.text: Like Scrabble? This is better. No board, you arrange the letters anyway you would like. It has fun banana lingo to go the moves. It is a tile arranging, letter arranging, word game. Great for vocabulary practice. Great for a quick fun game. Can be two player or multi-player. It comes in a small banana shaped bag that is easy to use and store.Want to be a top banana? This game is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Thompson

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: Great game; so fun to play. Kids spelling has improved from playing this. They enjoy trying to make longer, more impressive words than their opponents. Have played with a group of adult women. Lots of laughter and fun. We love that everyone can play at their own level based on their own vocabulary, so young and old can play together well.
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game. My daughter and I love to play it. It’s easy to learn, fast paced, makes you laugh, especially when you forget which word your supposed to holler out. It’s easy to pack up & take on vacation. Tiles could get easily lost but we haven’t lost any yet.
customer_reviews.author: Paris Girl

customer_reviews.title: I don’t know Hebrew....
customer_reviews.text: I love bananagrams with a passion, and was excited to find it on amazon. Unfortunately, when it arrived at my house I opened the package and did not understand what the outside peel said. Upon some research and according to a Jewish friend, it is in Hebrew, all of the letters, the instructions, and which is fantastic that bananagrams is so multilingual, but also, I am neither Jewish nor do I know Hebrew, thus rendering useless to me unless I take a lot of time to learn another language or convert.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: HIGHLY ADDICTIVE AND HIGHLY COMPETITIVE!
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: HIGHLY ADDICTIVE AND HIGHLY COMPETITIVE! This game has definitely got in the way of mine and my partner's relationship. I bought it because I played it with friends, but little did I know that bringing it home from Amazon would mean declaring war! All jokes aside, this is a fun take on Scrabble. It is fast-paced, intellectual and fun - all at the same time. I would recommend Bananagrams to any household - be it just a couple of you, or a whole family!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Gonzo

customer_reviews.title: Great game! Fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Great game! Everyone, young or old, loves to play with these tiles! It's great for kids to build vocabulary and spell words they know! My elderly mother is covinced they're made of ivory. You can play many games with this. Our Spanish neighbor kids used it to show us matching English and Spanish words. Of course the regular game rules are easy and fun for friends & family too. We often play as teams. Laughter ensues!
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: Tactile
customer_reviews.text: This game of tile letters is really fun for word lovers. You can play it alone or with any number of others. Each person draws 21 tiles and then makes them into a crossword. The person to finish first wins. Only two simple rules. Besides, the banana is really silly and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Triss

customer_reviews.title: Don’t pass this up!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this game! My twins and I started playing it at the dinner table when they were nine but I wish I’d known about it when they were younger. It’s not hard to learn, we laugh, help one another if it’s been one of those days, and laugh more. Every family needs this game.
customer_reviews.author: Woman of all Trades

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to learn. Traveling with a fun game is made easy. My grandsons, 10 and 13. thoroughly enjoyed it, as well as the adults in the family. Not only is it good for spelling, but also increases your vocabulary. We played it at a vacation rental home and enjoyed it so much we bought 3 more to have at both of our houses and 1 for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda K. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: LOVE Bananagrams
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered several "Bananas!" I love this game. It really agrees with my sensibility! And when I share it with others, and THEY enjoy it, I often give my game away. Twice now, the banana came the next day with the last two orders I sent in! Love your great service! ....hmmm, it may be a teacher thing, but I just love this game! ...and I love 'paying it forward."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This game is majorly addicting for all ages should buy
customer_reviews.text: This game is super addicting whether you like word games or not. I got this game to play while I was in the hospital and I had all the nurses in love with it. It’s pretty competitive and everyone gets super into it. I love how easy it is to travel with it and it’s great for playing with younger kids because they can make their own words and they don’t slow down the game. Highly highly highly recommend this game love it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: good game.  this is my third purchase
customer_reviews.text: my now 13 year old loves this game and has been playing for a couple years. She takes it everywhere, hence my third purchase. Sometimes it doesn't make it back home. Great game to throw in her suitcase when going to friends. I'm not a guy who likes to play board games, but this is kinda fun even for me.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Lewison

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for the value you pay.
customer_reviews.text: Friend of mine taught me how to play this game I was intrigued it’s almost like playing scrabble but a lot more fun that was a great time and a great day learning how to play this game it’s almost like playing strip poker play banana grams poker. Great Girl from Florence Mass.
customer_reviews.author: Awesome Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Fun educational game
customer_reviews.text: This Isa game to be enjoyed by anyone who is phonetically inclined- meaning who enjoys language and words! It's better than Scrabble because you can switch words during the game to accommodate the new letters you acquire at each turn. Just a joy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun, portable game that is easy to play!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun, easy to learn game that the whole family can enjoy together (at least, kids old enough to spell out words confidently). Fast paced. The best speller is not necessarily guaranteed to win. Portable to play anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: MtnGirl12

customer_reviews.title: Love word games!
customer_reviews.text: I have recently become addicted to playing board games with friends and family! This game is easy fun if you know others who enjoy word games like Boggle or Scrabble, You basically create a crossword puzzle using every single tile. Its fun and I love the banana packaging .
customer_reviews.author: Steph H.

customer_reviews.title: Better than Scrabble
customer_reviews.text: Because you create your words independently from other players this game goes quicker and is more satisfying that Scrabble. Easily fits in a backpack or suitcase but you do need a large surface to play i.e. a coffee table.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Winner w/some changes
customer_reviews.text: We love this game but changed the rules just a little to make it more fun for us. We regularly say things like “peel 5” and don’t wait until we are out of letters to peel. When just two of us play, we start with 30 letters instead of 21.
customer_reviews.author: E. DeJesus

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Fun
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved playing Scrabble and this is like Scrabble on steroids. Each player races through, simultaneously building words and trying to be the first to use their letters. It's a compact game, easy to take anywhere because it's zipped in a banana. Great mental exercise to wake you up.
customer_reviews.author: tairzjx

customer_reviews.title: Family Favorite
customer_reviews.text: This has quickly become one of our favorite family games. It's fast, and all my teens enjoy showing off their impressive vocabularies.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Clayton

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of this game before the bloggers/ig ladies "our time of the month" mentioned it. It is like scrabble but more exciting and fun. You really have to be quick on your toes you also have to be ready to change your entire board to fit one letter in.
customer_reviews.author: D. Levroney

customer_reviews.title: English order should be English letters
customer_reviews.text: Wish there was a negative review star. After reading and rereading the product it sounded like what I wanted but when I got it, it was in Arabic letters, not English. Had it open already so I couldn't return it. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: R Sapieka

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any game night
customer_reviews.text: This has been a family and classroom favorite since it's purchase! This game is challenging for all ages and abilities because of how it can be customized. The tiles are high quality and make it easy to bring along on a road trip, etc. A must have for any game night!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great game. Similar
customer_reviews.text: Great game. Similar , but much better than Scrabble. Each player is active the whole game (rather than just during their turn.) Each player makes their own word layouts. You can change anything in your layout at any time. Its easy to transport to neighbors, relatives, or when you travel, in a suitcase or purse. Try it. You'll like it.
customer_reviews.author: T. WOOLAWAY

customer_reviews.title: Fun Family Game, easy to travel with
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister for Christmas, and she jumped out of her seat when she opened it up! I had no idea a little game could get someone so excited. We all played it after dinner, and it brought hours of enjoyment. This is a no pressure game, you go at your own speed, and is very entertaining. The carrying pouch makes traveling with the game so easy, so you can bring it along to parties or wherever. I will be ordering one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Hukill

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I like that each player forms their own words, which is different from scrabble where everyone works off one board. My grandchildren enjoy finding letters and small words-helps with reading and learning the alphabet for even young ones.
customer_reviews.author: DneezeS

customer_reviews.title: This game is only fun if you get the right crowd
customer_reviews.text: This game is only fun if you get the right crowd. Some people hate "thinking" games when they're drinking. Half my friends didn't want to touch it and the other half vowed to come back and play it another time. This is like scrabble but faster and more fun in my opinion. I also didn't play by the exact rules. We divided the tiles evenly amongst the players and then just played until no one had any tiles left. Helps to have less rules when you're drinking.
customer_reviews.author: No

customer_reviews.title: Very fun! Great for anyone who likes word games
customer_reviews.text: If you like any type of word game (e.g. text twist, scrabble, crosswords, etc.), you'll love this! It's fun for adults and kids. I like how there's the element of competing against each other for who's fastest - which makes it a a quicker-paced game than other word games like scrabble that are a little slower paced games. Very fun, and will play it lots.
customer_reviews.author: Felecia Martin

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GIFT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a child really into numbers and letters and he plays with it all the time. It is a nice product to be used by one person or as a game. I might add, the child is a special needs child, and numbers and letters are really the thing he excels in. The price was right as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scrabble without the board
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a gift for my mom because I hate scrabble (I always lose), and she loves scrabble. So naturally she loves this! You can play it with just one player so it is a fantastic game if you like games but can't get others to join you. Multiple times now however, when playing with a group of people, we're found that you can get stuck and then you just are stuck the entire game (bad luck. Same thing could happen in scrabble as well) Also it's funny because you can easily cheat along the way but when you get to the end they will find out!
customer_reviews.author: Epic

customer_reviews.title: My favorite game
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a present and it has since been one of my favorite games. It's now my go to gift for Christmas since anyone can learn it. You can play it by yourself or with a group. There are 144 tiles and the letters are engraved with black ink on each tile. I've had mine for over 5 years now and the letters are all still visible. I personally wash the tiles every couple of months since I like to play it on the floor and they're still fine. While I understand that you can play with scrabble pieces, I like the feel and weight of the Bananagrams tiles more.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Best addiction for your brain. Get those synapses firing. Adapt or lose. PEEL!!!
customer_reviews.text: Xdyfneowpqaiibvsaojqm LOVE THIS GAME. Discovered it while on vacation in Jamaica and couldn’t stop playing it. Got back Stateside and immediately ordered 5 sets for friends who read lot and have good vocabularies. They are all now hooked.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Douglas

customer_reviews.title: A Fun Word Game
customer_reviews.text: We are game loving family. There is nothing we dislike about Bananagrams. It doesn't take too long to play a round. Sometimes we don't have a lot of time, so we will play a quick round. We usually spend Sunday morning or afternoon playing games. Good for kids because it doesn't take as long as a game of Scrabble or Upwords.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with Bananagrams! This game is fun for Scrabble lovers and non-lovers alike. It's very portable, so perfect for bringing on vacation or to a friend's house. If you want a long game, you can play a bunch of consecutive rounds, but if a short game is more up your alley you can limit it to just one or two rounds. This game is great for all ages, and even very young children enjoy playing with the letters (even if they can't yet read or spell)!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley D.

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: this is a fun game, easy to take places, and easy to play by yourself if you want. It's a good mind exercise. I had it years ago and replaced it recently. I highly recommend this to anybody who likes word games. Plus, it's nice to have something tangible that isn't on your phone.
customer_reviews.author: jdartist

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I eventually want to get all the fruits like this banana. I saw an idea where someone got all of the games and put them in a bowl so it looked like a bowl of healthy foods (apple, pear, banana). It’s a fun game too lol not just for decoration 😂
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: In so many words, it is FUN!
customer_reviews.text: We discovered this game when my wife was in the hospital for several months. She had some cognition issues and her therapist introduced the game during one of her sessions. It’s basically like Scrabble without the board. It challenges your ability to form words and use up lettered tiles. Easy to learn and great fun.
customer_reviews.author: JASRBC Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game! Love the fast-paced competition of this game. I've used it with my 7 year old too to help with spelling though we play with much different rules to make it easier. Loads of fun for a wide age range. Just make sure to validate spelling before declaring a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Jojo's Momma

customer_reviews.title: Best game ever.
customer_reviews.text: Best game ever!!! Simple but challenging every time. Played with a friend and then bought it for ourselves, and now all of our friends are buying it too! Even the guy who doesn't like games likes it! If you don't like waiting around while other players take their turn this game would be for you.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Boop

customer_reviews.title: She gobbled it up.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with the intent of helping my nine year old granddaughter expand her already extensive vocabulary. She is putting us all to shame and she relishes every minute. We have such fun.
customer_reviews.author: SuLaine

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to learn
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my best friends grandson who is starting first grade. As a teacher I know this is a fun learning tool for spelling, reading and phonics. My students could play with this game for hours!!
customer_reviews.author: Katy B

customer_reviews.title: Bananas for Bananagrams!!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS GAME. If you don't like having to wait on folks to complete their turns or be limited to a board in Scrabble, this is the game for you! I will say, if you don't like fast paced games than this may not be the game for you.
customer_reviews.author: Dalia

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our 20 year-old nephew gifted us this game. My husband and I play at least three games a day. We have a on paper tally and we run neck and neck. I've gifted it to my brother and his wife and they too play daily during this COVID period. I've gifted this game to pregnant mama awaiting their first child as they were trying to pass the time.
customer_reviews.author: George E. Zeiner

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous for All Ages!
customer_reviews.text: Received this for Christmas for our kids, our whole family can't stop playing it. Our six year old can make a grid of three and four letter words, while the adults go for longer ones. But the game is all about the endgame, a whole lot of fun for everyone. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Valtenbergs

customer_reviews.title: Great game for many uses
customer_reviews.text: I really was happy to get these. It is a excel game to play with friends. We spend hours playing and it also would be great for teaching a child letters or how to spell. The banana case is also cute. My only reason for rating a 4 over a 5 was because I had to get the case stitched it had a tear from the company missing a spot and tiles were in danger of falling out. I don't think any tiles were lost in processing. However I would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: T. Combs

customer_reviews.title: An all-time favorite
customer_reviews.text: We love playing Bananagrams with family and friends. Its always a blast, and the games are so competitive. It plays on your ability to make connections, quick decisions, and can really test your lexicon. Lots of funny, easy to pack along, and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Game night with learning
customer_reviews.text: We found one of these in our vacation cabin. Played every night and purchased for home. Comes in a kiddie version too! This is a family game where we all build on skills and laugh. LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: a fun game for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: a fun game for the whole family, well, anybody who knows how to spell, so i guess like 2nd grade and up, probably. it is a reasonably short game, maybe 20 minutes to play, less when you have more players. easy to take along to play wheverever you go. cute banana bag to hold it all.
customer_reviews.author: Goldjay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Brain Games!
customer_reviews.text: I use this game to play a solo word game with myself a few times a week. I like doing brain games to keep myself sharp and stretch my vocabulary. I shared a post on my Instagram about the benefits of brain games, no matter your age. Follow me on Instagram @blkgirlwellness for holistic wellness tips.
customer_reviews.author: Pavielle Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!
customer_reviews.text: Love this game! Simple rules and since everyone plays with their own tiles at the same time, no issues with waiting turns and getting bored. Travels well. Ideal poolside or beach game since the tiles are plastic and there is no board so it's fine if they get wet.
customer_reviews.author: Island Pediatrician

customer_reviews.title: fast and fun
customer_reviews.text: I'm 68 - having a great time playing. I'm a lousy speller so most of the time at a disadvantage. I've never really won like I think I have due to misspelled words. Despite an almost no win record it's still fun and I like the speed. We've reworked the rules to include abbreviations which helps adult beginners enormously and I use the cell phone/google to look up words faster than I can flipping through a dictionary. Google can decipher my spelling and get me where I want to go.
customer_reviews.author: porge

customer_reviews.title: Favorite game!
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game! If you like scrabble, you’ll like this even more because it’s faster. I like combining quick thinking with scrabble. I could play this game all day!
customer_reviews.author: Maurine

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the family, even if you don't play by the rules
customer_reviews.text: We don't play by the rules, but everyone loves building crosswords from these letter tiles. It's great for kids who are learning to read and spell and fun for the family to do together.
customer_reviews.author: kcnewmom

customer_reviews.title: Our family loved playing banagrams when we received it as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Our family loved playing banagrams when we received it as a gift. Then my 87 year old Mom and her friends discovered that it's fun to have the tiles handy when working on word jumbles. Moving the tiles around is good for dexterity, and it's fun to see the words form from the movable tiles.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M

customer_reviews.title: Fun game and makes you think
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 13 and 14 year old so we could have a more advanced game to play around the house. We actually took it to a friends house the first time playing it and played a large group. It was super fun and we all had a good laugh at the words we came up with. It's a game we pull out often to play too.
customer_reviews.author: P. Allison

customer_reviews.title: You don’t have to use the banana bag or theme if you don’t want to.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a Scrabble purist and so tend to shun other word games. However, my partner has wanted this for years, so I finally agreed to play. Honestly, it’s not really like Scrabble. It’s a fun, quick game that we’ve enjoyed playing a couple times so far.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit! Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Listen - I LOVE Bananagrams but unfortunately this is NOT the official bananagrams game. The pieces are different sizes and thicknesses, different fonts, don't feel like the good ol' Bananagrams that I know and love. So sad.
customer_reviews.author: Kiersten

customer_reviews.title: You must own this game!!!
customer_reviews.text: This game is SO much fun. My husband and I enjoy playing and I always throw it in my bag when we're eating out with our family- my 7 and 6 year old love it, too- it's the perfect thing to keep them still in their chairs while we're waiting for our food. We also play a hangman version of it- so nice not to have paper and pen everywhere. Plus, it's so stimulating for the kids, I love how it's helping their spelling and reading skills all while hidden in a game!!
customer_reviews.author: E. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Words/ any words!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect game for those who want to like scrabble but don’t want to mess with big words or complicated point bonuses. It’s fast and easy to play.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycee

customer_reviews.title: New favorite game
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life!!! SO HAPPY to have found this game. Fun for the whole family - age 12-70 over the holidays. Every household should have this game!! I need one for the car and the RV!
customer_reviews.author: CLC

customer_reviews.title: Great for waiting at restaurants!
customer_reviews.text: Great for traveling and those times you need to wait. When kids are bored-skip the board games and bring this out for a quick reset! In general I am a big fan of scrabble and now I do see playing Bananagrams you really don't get to talk with each other like in scrabble, so that is the only downfall, but it is a speed scrabble and you can get as creative as you want on your own! FUN! The little ones can team up with the bigs and it is fun for whole family!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Barry

customer_reviews.title: Love this game, and love the storage pouch
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite games. My parents brought this (along with spicy farkel) to Guatemala this summer, and we played this for hours. I love that you are essentially playing your own scrabble board, but also competing against others at the same time. Very addicting. We had a group of ages 10-55 playing this game, and it worked out well. I would definitely recommend this to just about everyone.
customer_reviews.author: S.E.J.

customer_reviews.title: Play via Skype.
customer_reviews.text: If both ends of the computer/phone connection have a set of tiles, this is a fun game to play via zoom or FaceTime or Skype with friends and family. And if you bend the rules just a bit, even young beginning spellers/readers can join the fun. We keep searching for that type of game these days!
customer_reviews.author: VivaceBB

customer_reviews.title: Fun For the Whole family.
customer_reviews.text: It was "week at the farm" for my 3 grandchildren and I ordered this and one other game to add to my game collection. I was pleasantly surprised that my grown children and spouses enjoyed playing it with us as well. The ages of the players were 12 to 68 years of age. Really fun game and doesn't take nearly as long to play as Scrabble.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: I love this game! I work offshore and it always keeps me and my team entertained during down times. English is my second lenguaje so it has help me a lot to improve my grammar.
customer_reviews.author: Yessica

customer_reviews.title: Fun for everyone! Word game done right.
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. Though my husband and I are too competitive to play it one-on-one now. But seriously, in my opinion this is the best word game yet. The pace is actually fast enough and since there are no turns, you get to play the entire time! I like how short the rounds are; it makes it low commitment. One of the best features is how portable it is - we just grab the bag when we're heading up to visit family.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hess

customer_reviews.title: Great for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this game last week for my 5 kids ages 10-13. It's quickly become the favorite game. It's such a great and fun way to work on spelling which is huge for my dyslexic kiddos. They totally love it. I was kinda shocked but super happy. We play with a dictionary to determine real words and we've all learned some new ones. Best money I've spent all year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun and would definitely be appropriate for families. We find ourselves reaching for scrabble when we're at home, but this is a fun go to when I'm by myself or we're out somewhere and want to bring something small and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun in a Bag
customer_reviews.text: this is such a fun game for traveling comparatively to scrabble! its easy to learn and fun to play, unless you cannot spell worth a crap like my mother, then its really hard for you
customer_reviews.author: CadyP

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite games!
customer_reviews.text: Bananagrams is fun for everyone! Hours of fun, and it never gets old. love this game because it can be fun with only two people or a bigger group like five. It's fast paced and reminiscent of Scrabble. Get creative and add in your own rules (like playing off of other's boards or rotating seats to get a different player's board)! The game's case is aesthetic and durable yet flexible and small to throw in a bag even if you're headed somewhere for the weekend. I gifted this to my sister who is competitive and loves word games, and the whole family has benefitted since.
customer_reviews.author: Counselor Clique

customer_reviews.title: Very recommended and great quality
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game!! Cute pouch, high quality pieces, and a fun family game to practice words and spelling. Recommended for young readers and families!
customer_reviews.author: Erin W

product_meta.title: Bananagrams: Multi-Award-Winning Word Game
feature_bullets: FUN FOR EVERYONE – Gather your family and friends and race against each other to build crossword grids. This anagram game that will drive you bananas.
ENTERTAINING AND EDUCATIONAL – While this game is easy to play, Bananagrams is also educational. Teach your kids how to spell words and have fun at the same time.
GREAT FOR TRAVEL – Bananagrams comes in a fun banana-shaped case. This game doesn’t take much space like other board games and brings tons of fun while traveling.
MAKES A GREAT GIFT – Bananagrams will make a thoughtful gift for your friend or family member. It is perfect for both, boys and girls.
PLEASE NOTE – Contains small parts, not for children under 3 years. Perfect for anyone 7 years and up. 1-8 players.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.9 out of 5 stars7,301 ratings4.9 out of 5 stars
